intro: Triplostegia repens, commonly known as the creeping triplostegia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its slender, trailing stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a slightly hairy surface. Native to parts of Africa and the Middle East, it is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
